newsitem.title: UK: Hawtin tumbles after trading statement.
newsitem.headline: Hawtin tumbles after trading statement.

text.p: Shares in Hawtin Plc tumbled on Friday, shedding almost 20 percent of their value, after the group warned of possible sales losses during the first half, dealers said.
At 1058 GMT, the shares were down 9p to 37.
In a trading statement, Hawtin said the sole distribution agreement for Barclay Leisure products in the U.S. was terminated.
The company said it has lost sales during the time taken to set up a new distributor.
The cost associated with establishing a new U.S. distributor, coupled with the loss of sales, is likely to result in an overall loss in business in the first half.
The company also said start-up costs for its Therapeutic Centres and Meridian Leisure Developments will have a "substantial" effect on its results during the first half.
